item.title: About
item.description: About this site Hello, and welcome to my blog where I'll be writing about my tech ventures - both small and large, but also about stuff that I'm interested in in general. This is both a learning experience and applying of what I already know. The blog will mostly be centered around general problem-solving, and functional-first programming languages such as F# and in a lesser extent OCaml. You won't be able to comment, but I do welcome quality feedback nevertheless.

item.title: Big number implementation in F# - part 1
item.description: Some time ago while I was in the college, we've got a task for homework to implement a class in C++ that will represent a large positive number. The large number will have a predefined maximum number of digits (i.e. 50), and it should support addition and multiplication operations via operator overloading. As someone who is learning a language somewhat different than what he's used to, I've decided to revisit that task and do the same in F#, but with few differences:
